channel.title: How to hide rar's in image files
channel.description:
I found this lurking around the internet and thought it might peak the interest of some of you [QUOTE]A short tutorial to show people how its possible to hide files within a picture file (especially png and jpeg files) and all you'll need is a program like WinRAR.
Firstly you'll need to find two things: the first is a picture that you'll use to hide your file in, the second is the actual file you want to hide.
Put both in the same folder, open a command prompt and navigate there.
Once there you'll need to put your file that you want to hide inside a zip file (rar or zip will work just fine, put a password or whatever if you want too). After this type the following into the command prompt:
[CODE] copy /b display.png + secret_message.rar fake.png[/CODE]
where display.png is the picture in which you want to hide the file, secret_message.rar is the file you want to hide and fake.png is the file name that you want the result to be created as.
After this is done open the newly created image file in your paint package and verify that it opens correctly. To see the hidden file all you need to do is open it in your favorite compression program and your done! One hidden file that can be uploaded to image sites and so forth.
As I said you can also put a password on the rar hidden rar file in order to add extra protection.
Enjoy![/QUOTE]

item.title: How to hide rar's in image files
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

[quote=“FastBawlz, post:18, topic:310245”][quote author=bootnecklad link=topic=406673.msg3004956#msg3004956 date=1256324414]
I’ve been looking for this! Thanks!
[/quote]

Really? Apparently you’re not looking that hard.
http://www.google.com/search?source=ig&hl=en&rlz=&q=how+to+hide+rar+in+jpg&aq=f&oq=&aqi=[/quote]

I hadn’t even started to look. I opened up mitb.com and I found this. No need for me to search

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:10, topic:310245”]If anyone is interested, the unix command would be:

cat file.png file.rar > newfile.png

I do remember this discussion, but I ignored it because it really doesn’t make that much sense to do.[/quote]
Unless you’re hiding something you’re not supposed to have :/.

edit: but I do agree this is stupid.

item.title: How to hide rar's in image files
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

[quote=“TLitten, post:8, topic:310245”]if /b is so goddam necessary, then why the flying fuck and i getting successful combined rar/png? i do not understand /b would you care to enlighten me? also what is <pre…> both were not in my line and i succeeded in combining.

Also, Smd and Smd[/quote]

Binary copies "COPY /B ... " will copy all the files in binary mode , you can also put /B after any one file to copy just that file in binary.
 
Is a html snipplet proof of a bad copy and paste job nothing more.
          

          
Read full topic

item.title: How to hide rar's in image files
item.dc:creator: @TLitten TLitten
item.description:
@TLitten wrote:

this is really cool but i cant seem to unrar the image, maybe doing it wrong

but heres better instructions

How to navigate:

  1. go to cmd

  2. type wherever your folder is located ----> cd c:\desktop\folder <----example, “cd” is required

Instructions:

copy picture.png + archive.rar hidden_archive_in_pic.png

“picture.png” is your pic “archive.rar” is the rar file “hidden_archive_in_pic.png” is the outcome laced image file. Basically exactly what sanga said but without /b and

i cant seem to unrar the image though, maybe someone else can explain better, but credit to sanga, thanks

Read full topic
